image.altText: A still from a video appearing to show former SA Liberal leader David Speirs leaning over a plate and snorting.

props.synopsis: South Australia's Liberal leader Vincent Tarzia says he has been assured that a video allegedly showing his predecessor David Speirs snorting powder off a plate is a "deepfake", and that he has advised Mr Speirs to report it to authorities.

title.children: Snorting video appearing to show former SA opposition leader a 'complete shock' to Liberal successor

image.altText: A view of the Whyalla steelworks taken at sunset

props.synopsis: A former steelworks employee says he fears someone will “get hurt” because not enough preventative maintenance work was being done at the Whyalla plant, but the company says it is committed to safety and its green iron and steel plans.

title.children: Sources raise alarm on 'pathetic' conditions and safety concerns at Whyalla Steelworks as owner says it is cutting costs amid steel price slump

image.altText: Mother and children together on a brown couch and smile at the camera, with both children leaning into their mother

props.synopsis: Finding the best school for a child can be a daunting decision for parents and one which experts say should be based on the individual learning style of each child.

title.children: Siblings Rufus and Rosie had 'such different needs' – so their parents decided to send them to different schools

image.altText: Terry Buckley holds potatoes at his farm.

props.synopsis: Australian supermarkets have high standards for how a spud should look. Producers say the focus should be on the taste instead.

title.children: Skin-deep beauty standards for Australian potatoes leading to 'absurd' amount of waste

image.altText: Small group of protesters near some trees

props.synopsis: A conservation group is lobbying Adelaide councils to save thousands of trees from the axe each year as a petrol station giant's plan to remove two significant river red gums in the inner south is delayed.

title.children: Adelaide's 'abysmal' canopy cover fuels protests against tree lopping

image.altText: Troy Bell walks outside a court building holding a note pad.

props.synopsis: Independent SA MP Troy Stephen Bell allegedly failed to return more than $400,000 to the accounts of not-for-profit education organisations he managed in the state's south-east, a court has heard.

title.children: MP accused of fraud stole more than $400k from not-for-profits, court hears

image.altText: Nicola Spurrier at press conference

props.synopsis: South Australia has reported a six year high in whooping cough cases as the illness spikes across the country.

title.children: Whooping cough cases surging, with vulnerable groups urged to get vaccinated

image.altText: Consumer groups letter to federal treasurer and drone image of Sydney suburb

props.synopsis: Choice and the Owners Corporation Network are among the consumer groups that have endorsed an open letter to the federal treasurer calling for urgent action.

title.children: 'Tip of the iceberg': Top consumer groups demand urgent federal inquiry into strata industry

image.altText: A boy with a blurry face holds a phone, the light illuminating his face against the darkened background.

props.synopsis: Anthony Albanese vows to introduce legislation to ban children from accessing social media by the end of this year — but the age cut-off is yet to be determined.

title.children: Social media ban for children to be introduced before the end of this year

image.altText: A younger woman's hand holding an elderly patient's hand.

props.synopsis: The federal opposition has raised fresh concerns about proposed widespread reform to the aged care sector, leaving the immediate future of the promised new Aged Care Act up in the air.

title.children: Coalition flags unnamed concerns about aged care reforms, leaving sector in limbo

image.altText: Angus Taylor, Jim Chalmers 20221026_192814850_iOS

props.synopsis: Jim Chalmers launches an extraordinary broadside after failing to land an agreement with the Coalition on plans to reform the Reserve Bank of Australia.

title.children: Chalmers bombards Coalition with insults after Reserve Bank negotiations fall apart

image.altText: Composite image of a man wearing a suit and tie, and an image of race horses and money

props.synopsis: Paul Montgomery was brought in by these brothers as a trusted friend to run the financial side of their business but as they made him general manager, he stole millions, was duchessed by gambling company VIPs and lost it all while on a multi-million dollar losing streak.

title.children: 'The Golden Goose' that cooked the books, a business and lifelong friendships as he gambled the millions he stole

image.altText: A man in a suit speaking, with another man out of focus behind him.

props.synopsis: The Coalition says the time for negotiations has passed after the treasurer lashed the opposition for failing to support its RBA reforms.

title.children: Coalition refusing to back RBA reforms, even if govt agrees to demands — as it happened

image.altText: Police and ambulance vehicles in in a suburban street

props.synopsis: Police have confirmed the two children, aged nine and 11, were found dead west of Sydney.

title.children: Two boys found dead inside Blue Mountains home

image.altText: A wom and man in formal clothes and sunglasses walking

props.synopsis: Families have told a sentencing hearing for a bus driver who caused a fatal crash in the NSW Hunter Valley that their lives have been "shattered".

title.children: Hunter crash survivor details 'overwhelming sensation I was going to die' in emotional hearing

image.altText: A sign that says Google behind a white background.

props.synopsis: The antitrust lawsuit comes a month after a federal judge declared that Google's search engine was an illegal monoply.

title.children: Google facing antitrust lawsuit over advertising technology

image.altText: A woman with blonde hair looks into the camera with a pained expression.

props.synopsis: Alison Whitfield's husband Dave, a veteran medic with the Australian Defence Force, took his own life earlier this year. She desperately hopes other families do not have to experience the same pain.

title.children: The royal commission laid bare the anguish veterans face. Now their families say it's time to fix the system

image.altText: People stand around the edge of a deep crater in the sand

props.synopsis: At least 40 people have been killed in the camp in Khan Younis, in the designated humanitarian "safe zone" of Gaza.

title.children: 'Entire families disappeared under the sand' as Israeli strikes hit Gazan tent camp

image.altText: A bright orange globe and streak of light show where a drone was shot down over a city at night.

props.synopsis: NATO countries are becoming increasingly vocal about their capabilities to shoot down Russia drones and missiles, as Romania and Latvia become the latest members of the Western alliance to report Moscow violated their airspace.

title.children: Russian drones are entering NATO airspace, and some members say it's their 'duty' to respond

image.altText: Environment Minister Tanya Plibersek sitting in Question Time

props.synopsis: The Labor senators on a Senate committee want the government bill to include new environmental standards, which the environment minister had planned to defer.

title.children: Labor senators have dealt a blow to Tanya Plibersek's environment agency plans

image.altText: A white woman with short brown hair looking into the camera and smiling

props.synopsis: Many neurodivergent people with eating disorders say traditional treatments haven't considered their unique needs. Now there's a push towards a more tailored approach.

title.children: Traditional treatment for eating disorders left a woman traumatised. She wants other neurodivergent people to know 'there's a way out'

image.altText: The Princess of Wales and her family sit smiling at the camera in a rural setting with green trees in the background

props.synopsis: The Princess of Wales confirms she is no longer receiving chemotherapy, and says she will return to a light program of external engagements in the coming months.

title.children: Princess of Wales no longer receiving chemotherapy and 'doing what I can to stay cancer free'

image.altText: A man in a suit speaks at a lectern into a microphone.

props.synopsis: A shake-up of the state election board in Georgia means it's now controlled by Republicans, who are changing voting rules. Democrats say it could be an attempt to "rig" the result.

title.children: This man stood up to Donald Trump after the 2020 election – and Brad Raffensperger says he'd do it all again

image.altText: A group of women holding placards and signs as they march on a street.

props.synopsis: Nurses and midwives have pushed ahead with significant stop work action despite being told not to by the Industrial Relations Commission as they fight for a 15 per cent pay rise.

title.children: NSW premier says nurse union's demands can't be met as thousands strike

image.altText: Shoppers walk through Pitt Street Mall

props.synopsis: With growth at the slowest pace in Australia since the recession of the early 1990s, we are now faced with an ongoing economic crisis in China — our biggest trading partner — and the prospect of a global economic slowdown.

title.children: Why the RBA will be forced to cut rates before year's end

image.altText: Darth Vader, Lando and Boba Fett having a conversation.

props.synopsis: The veteran actor died today at 93 but his legacy lives on in the iconic characters that he brought to life with his trademark voice and on-screen presence.

title.children: From Mufasa to Darth Vader, here are some of James Earl Jones's most iconic characters

image.altText: Joaquin Niemann watches a putt of his on the golf course

props.synopsis: Chile's Joaquin Niemann will be among a host of stars including Australia's Cameron Smith who aren't allowed to partake in this year's Presidents Cup due to their affiliation with LIV golf.

title.children: Reigning Australian Open champion Joaquin Niemann angered by continued Presidents Cup lockout

image.altText: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un stands at a podium with microphones

props.synopsis: Kim Jong Un said North Korea is facing a "grave threat" from what it said was a US-led nuclear-based military bloc in the region.

title.children: North Korea's Kim Jong Un says country will increase number of nuclear weapons

image.altText: A smiling young man and a happy woman hug affectionately.

props.synopsis: Amid widespread elevated distress, Australia's new draft National Suicide Prevention Strategy, released today, focuses on a fundamental change to dealing with the social and economic factors behind feelings of hopelessness.

title.children: 'I wasn't mentally ill': Mum who considered taking own life has a message we need to hear

image.altText: a fire engine in front of a big clown face

props.synopsis: Six boys and a man died when the popular amusement park ride at Luna Park in Sydney was engulfed in flames 45 years ago. A coronial inquest, held that same year, found the cause of the fire could not be determined.

title.children: NSW coroner handed redacted police report into Luna Park Ghost Train fire

image.altText: Two women look at a share price board outside the ASX in Sydney.

props.synopsis:
Wall Street indices jump more than a point and the treasurer discusses new RBA legislation.

Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: Wall Street indices jump more than a point, treasurer discusses RBA legislation, news on markets and business

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: How to revitalise Europe's economies? Mario Draghi's recommendations
Europe needs 'unprecedented' investment to meet 'existential challenge'

image.altText: Thmib1

props.synopsis: The Miami Dolphins have hit out at police after footage of star NFL wide receiver Tyreek Hill being arrested appeared to show excessive force being used.

title.children: Body camera footage shows arrest of NFL star Tyreek Hill as police criticised for using excessive force

image.altText: Lleyton Hewitt speaks at a press conference

props.synopsis: Although injury-hit Alex de Minaur has pulled out, Lleyton Hewitt is convinced his in-form Australian side can navigate the Davis Cup Finals' "group of death".

title.children: 'We back ourselves against anyone': Australia not fearing Davis Cup 'group of death'
